channel.title: Compiler problems.. help please!
channel.description:
OK so atm I am making a new server based with a Vanack source and the compiler I got with it says it is 1.9
I open up the compiler and press "C" and "R" for compile and run but both say the same thing... they both say:
"You do not have JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0 or any JDK 5.0 and 6.0 updates. Go to Mod Taharok's tutorial on the Moparscape Tuturoials section for step-by-step instructions to download the newest JDK Update. Press any key to continue..."
I have the newest version of JDK which is the 6u1 update... Does this one not work? Am I supposed to use an older version of JDK?
If anyone can answer these questions I would be extremely grateful!!

item.title: Compiler problems.. help please!
item.dc:creator: @projectpkerz projectpkerz

@projectpkerz wrote:

ill try to make a good comipler to day kk

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler problems.. help please!
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

Tai`:

Ok, this is what I do, I don’t have JDK at all…I get an old source, the ones that just “_” At first, then they say the errors , or compiled succesfully… It works fine for me…

You obviously have the JDK if you can compile.

@_Vengeance wrote:

javac *.java

item.title: Compiler problems.. help please!
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

What is with all the 200 line compilers?

@echo off
Title Compiler
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" *.java
pause

I mean fuck!

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler problems.. help please!
item.dc:creator: @Fireskrit Fireskrit
item.description:
@Fireskrit wrote:

Ok I had a crash course in compiler updates… a very short ahem 5 min course… and I managed to change the compiler in my other server to work fine now. I used different sources from here and the onyl way I could manage it was because I download JDK 6u4 recently.

I’d like to thank everyone for posting diff’ compiler sources, they all have their advantages and some have their disadvantages… not pointing any fingers here…

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler problems.. help please!
item.dc:creator: @Fireskrit Fireskrit
item.description:
@Fireskrit wrote:

Lol thanks for all your replies guys, I don’t know how to actually change a compiler, but I used a different compiler that came with another source that I recently used but gave up on. ;D

Thanks for replies everyone!!

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler problems.. help please!
item.dc:creator: @Songoty Songoty
item.description:
@Songoty wrote:

You guys, he said he has Jdk 6 upadte 1 did he not?

@echo off
title compiler
"C:\program files\java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac" *.java
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler problems.. help please!
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Yell0w Mr Yell0w
item.description:
@Mr_Yell0w wrote:

use something simpler
like this

@echo off
title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_04\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler problems.. help please!
item.dc:creator: @Username Username
item.description:
@Username wrote:

:: ::
:: This Compiler is under no licenses and may ::
:: be distributed freely. ::
:: ::
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit
[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler problems.. help please!
item.dc:creator: @Anc13nt_Arr0w Anc13nt Arr0w
item.description:
@Anc13nt_Arr0w wrote:

Well, my compiler works well, its just what you need if that other 1 fails.

@echo off COLOR 09 title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler problems.. help please!
item.dc:creator: @musicmad441 Musicmad
item.description:
@musicmad441 wrote:

[quote=“Fireskrit, post:1, topic:182904”]OK so atm I am making a new server based with a Vanack source and the compiler I got with it says it is 1.9

I open up the compiler and press “C” and “R” for compile and run but both say the same thing… they both say:

“You do not have JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0 or any JDK 5.0 and 6.0 updates. Go to Mod Taharok’s tutorial on the Moparscape Tuturoials section for step-by-step instructions to download the newest JDK Update. Press any key to continue…”

I have the newest version of JDK which is the 6u1 update… Does this one not work? Am I supposed to use an older version of JDK?

If anyone can answer these questions I would be extremely grateful!![/quote]

If you are sure that you have JDK, use this compiler:

@echo off if exist "C:\Program Files (x86)\" set programfiles=C:\Program Files (x86) set pro=%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_03 set pro2=%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_03 set jac=\bin\javac.exe set jav=\bin\java.exe :co1 set b=0 set t=7 goto co2 :co2 color %b%%t% :menu cls title Fire Wolf's Compiler echo Please choose an Command below to get started. echo. echo. echo. echo c - Compiles your server. echo r - Runs your server. echo e - Exit out of this program. echo color - Change the Text and Backround colors of this Updater. echo reset - Resets your Updater Logs. echo. echo. set /p c=Option: if %c%==c goto c if %c%==C goto c if %c%==r goto r if %c%==R goto r if %c%==color goto color if %c%==Color goto color if %c%==COLOR goto color if %c%==reset goto reset if %c%==Reset goto reset if %c%==RESET goto reset if %c%==e goto e if %c%==E goto e if %c%==* goto er goto er :color cls echo Would you like to change the backround color or echo change the text color echo. echo backround - Change the backround color. echo text - Change the text color. echo back - Change all colors back to default. echo exit - To exit out this program echo. set /p color=Option: if %color%==backround goto back if %color%==BACKROUND goto back if %color%==text goto text if %color%==TEXT goto text if %color%==back goto co1 if %color%==BACK goto co1 if %color%==exit goto e goto er :back cls echo Please select a color to change the backround to: echo. echo black echo white echo red echo yellow echo green echo blue echo purple echo. echo. set /p back=Color: if %back%== black (set b=0) if %back%== white (set b=7) if %back%== red (set b=4) if %back%== yellow (set b=6) if %back%== green (set b=2) if %back%== blue (set b=1) if %back%== purple (set b=5) goto co2 :text cls echo Please select a color to change the text to: echo. echo black echo white echo red echo yellow echo green echo blue echo purple echo. echo. set /p back=Color: if %back%== black (set t=0) if %back%== white (set t=7) if %back%== red (set t=4) if %back%== yellow (set t=6) if %back%== green (set t=2) if %back%== blue (set t=1) if %back%== purple (set t=5) goto co2 :c cls title Fire Wolf's Compiler goto cjc :c2 if exist src (goto cl) else (goto c3) :c3 if exist *.java (goto cl2) else (goto ce) :c4 %javac% -cp . *.java echo Server Compiled Successfully! pause cls goto menu :c5 %javac% -cp . .\src\*.java echo Server Compiled Successfully! pause move .\src\*.class .\classes\ cls goto menu :ce cls echo You need to have Java files for this Updater to Compile. pause cls goto menu :r cls title Fire Wolf's Run Server goto cj :r2 set rjava=%java% -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server cls goto r3 :r3 if exist .\classes\server.class (goto sl2) else (goto r4) :r4 if exist .\server.class (goto sl) else (goto se) :r5 %rjava% pause cls goto menu :r6 set rjava= set rjava=%java% -cp .;./classes; Server %rjava% pause cls goto menu :se cls title You Dont Have A Server.Class File echo You do not have a Server.class. Make sure that you have used the echo Compiler with your server before you try runing your server. pause cls goto menu :er cls title Ivalid Command echo Invalid command. Please make sure the commands you type echo in are correct. pause cls goto menu :e cls exit :cjc if exist "%pro%_06%jac%" (goto sjc) else (goto cjc2) :cjc2 if exist "%pro%_07%jac%" (goto sjc2) else (goto cjc3) :cjc3 if exist "%pro%_08%jac%" (goto sjc3) else (goto cjc4) :cjc4 if exist "%pro%_09%jac%" (goto sjc4) else (goto cjc5) :cjc5 if exist "%pro%_10%jac%" (goto sjc5) else (goto cjc6) :cjc6 if exist "%pro2%%jac%" (goto sjc6) else (goto cjc7) :cjc7 if exist "%pro%%jac%" (goto sjc7) else (goto cjc8) :cjc8 if exist "%pro%_01%jac%" (goto sjc8) else (goto cjc9) :cjc9 if exist "%pro%_02%jac%" (goto sjc9) else (goto cjc10) :cjc10 if exist "%pro%_03%jac%" (goto sjc10) else (goto cjc11) :cjc11 if exist "%pro%_04%jac%" (goto sjc11) else (goto cjc12) :cjc12 if exist "%pro%_05%jac%" (goto sjc12) else (goto je) :sjc set javac="%pro%_06%jac%" goto c2 :sjc2 set javac="%pro%_07%jac%" goto c2 :sjc3 set javac="%pro%_08%jac%" goto c2 :sjc4 set javac="%pro%_09%jac%" goto c2 :sjc5 set javac="%pro%_10%jac%" goto c2 :sjc6 set javac="%pro2%%jac%" goto c2 :sjc7 set javac="%pro%%jac%" goto c2 :sjc8 set javac="%pro%_01%jac%" goto c2 :sjc9 set javac="%pro%_02%jac%" goto c2 :sjc10 set javac="%pro%_03%jac%" goto c2 :sjc11 set javac="%pro%_04%jac%" goto c2 :sjc12 set javac="%pro%_05%jac%" goto c2 :cj if exist "%pro%_06%jav%" (goto sj) else (goto cj2) :cj2 if exist "%pro%_07%jav%" (goto sj2) else (goto cj3) :cj3 if exist "%pro%_08%jav%" (goto sj3) else (goto cj4) :cj4 if exist "%pro%_09%jav%" (goto sj4) else (goto cj5) :cj5 if exist "%pro%_10%jav%" (goto sj5) else (goto cj6) :cj6 if exist "%pro2%%jav%" (goto sj6) else (goto cj7) :cj7 if exist "%pro%%jav%" (goto sj7) else (goto cj8) :cj8 if exist "%pro%_01%jav%" (goto sj8) else (goto cj9) :cj9 if exist "%pro%_02%jav%" (goto sj9) else (goto cj10) :cj10 if exist "%pro%_03%jav%" (goto sj10) else (goto cj11) :cj11 if exist "%pro%_04%jav%" (goto sj11) else (goto cj12) :cj12 if exist "%pro%_05%jav%" (goto sj12) else (goto je) :sj set java="%pro%_06%jav%" goto r2 :sj2 set java="%pro%_07%jav%" goto r2 :sj3 set java="%pro%_08%jav%" goto r2 :sj4 set java="%pro%_09%jav%" goto r2 :sj5 set java="%pro%_10%jav%" goto r2 :sj6 set java="%pro2%%jav%" goto r2 :sj7 set java="%pro%%jav%" goto r2 :sj8 set java="%pro%_01%jav%" goto r2 :sj9 set java="%pro%_02%jav%" goto r2 :sj10 set java="%pro%_03%jav%" goto r2 :sj11 set java="%pro%_04%jav%" goto r2 :sj12 set java="%pro%_05%jav%" goto r2 :je cls title Error echo You do not have JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0 echo Download it now please echo Thank You pause cls goto menu :sl cls echo Ran Server at %time% and on %date%. >> "Compile Logs.txt" echo Server was run using %java%. >> "Compile Logs.txt" echo Thank-you for using Fire Wolf's Compiler! :) >> "Compile Logs.txt" echo. >> "Compile Logs.txt" goto r5 :sl2 cls echo Ran Server at %time% and on %date%. >> "Compile Logs.txt" echo Server was run using %java%. >> "Compile Logs.txt" echo Thank-you for using Fire Wolf's Compiler! :) >> "Compile Logs.txt" echo. >> "Compile Logs.txt" goto r6 :cl cls echo Compiled Java files at %time% and on %date%. >> "Compile Logs.txt" echo Java files were compiled using %javac%. >> "Compile Logs.txt" echo Thank-you for using Fire Wolf's Compiler! :) >> "Compile Logs.txt" echo. >> "Compile Logs.txt" goto c5 :cl2 cls echo Compiled Java files at %time% and on %date%. >> "Compile Logs.txt" echo Java files were compiled using %javac%. >> "Compile Logs.txt" echo Thank-you for using Fire Wolf's Compiler! :) >> "Compile Logs.txt" echo. >> "Compile Logs.txt" goto c4 :reset cls echo Resetting the Compiler's Logs... pause del "Compile Logs.txt" echo ----------Compiler Logs---------- >> "Compile Logs.txt" echo. >> "Compile Logs.txt" goto menu

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler problems.. help please!
item.dc:creator: @Fireskrit Fireskrit
item.description:
@Fireskrit wrote:

OK so atm I am making a new server based with a Vanack source and the compiler I got with it says it is 1.9

I open up the compiler and press “C” and “R” for compile and run but both say the same thing… they both say:

“You do not have JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0 or any JDK 5.0 and 6.0 updates. Go to Mod Taharok’s tutorial on the Moparscape Tuturoials section for step-by-step instructions to download the newest JDK Update. Press any key to continue…”

I have the newest version of JDK which is the 6u1 update… Does this one not work? Am I supposed to use an older version of JDK?

If anyone can answer these questions I would be extremely grateful!!
